snippet: Economic growth in 2014 should hit 1.1 percent in the euro area and 1.4 percent across the European Union and continue to strengthen in 2015.
abstract: European Union head of economy policy Olli Rehn says economic growth in 2014 should hit 1.1 percent in the euro area and 1.4 percent across the European Union and continue to strengthen in 2015; predicts unemployment is likely to remain high in some countries and even rise.

byline.contributor:
Jack Ewing contributed reporting
from Frankfurt and David Jolly
from Paris.

lead_paragraph: Economic growth in 2014 should hit 1.1 percent in the euro area and 1.4 percent across the European Union and continue to strengthen in 2015.

headline.main: E.U. Predicts Anemic Growth and High Unemployment in 2014
headline.print_headline:
E.U. Predicts
Flat Growth
And Increase
In Joblessness
